title: Lowering Prescription Drug Costs for Americans

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the Department of Health and Human Services to explore and test new healthcare payment and delivery models aimed at lowering prescription drug costs for Medicare and Medicaid beneficiaries. It builds on previous laws and initiatives to make medications more affordable and reduce out-of-pocket expenses for Americans.
potential_concerns: Implementation delays or bureaucratic hurdles could slow the testing and rollout of new payment models.
Pharmaceutical companies might increase drug prices elsewhere to offset revenue lost from price negotiations and caps.

Medicare and Medicaid beneficiaries could face disruptions or confusion if cost-sharing structures change rapidly.
There may be legal or administrative challenges in applying inflation-based drug price rebate requirements.
